evidence: The 0.2% yield stress σ 0.2 , i.e. the stress at which the strain deviates by more than 0.2% from the linear elastic behavior, amounts to 822 MPa. The final ingot consisted of a single phase of body-centered structure, with single-grain sizes between about 0.5 and 1 mm.
The yield stresses observed in our experiments are significantly lower, amounting to about 850 MPa at RT and decreasing to about 600 MPa at 300 °C.
The Nb-Mo-Ta-W alloy at RT shows a yield stress of 1,058 MPa, which is considerably higher than that found in the present study, and the sample failed at a plastic strain of about 2.0%.
The fivecomponent alloy V-Nb-Mo-Ta-W showed an even higher yield strength of 1,246 MPa and failed at a plastic strain of about 1.5%.
Figure 8. (a) High-resolution HAADF-STEM micrograph of the Zr-Nb-Ti-Ta-Hf high-entropy alloy deformed at 200 °C up to 9%, and (b) schematic representation of the differently oriented areas in (a).
